example.voku: Ka sana-nava move eko hima-kosa fari.
example.gloss: DECL starship move toward planet far
example.english: The starship travels to a distant planet.

example.voku: Ka hima-kosa move eno sana-kema.
example.gloss: DECL planet move in orbit
example.english: The planet moves in its orbit.

example.voku: Ka hasa-sana move ulo hima-tor.
example.gloss: DECL comet move through universe
example.english: The comet travels through the universe.

example.voku: Ka tufa-sana ure vasi en lumi.
example.gloss: DECL nebula be large and bright
example.english: The nebula is large and bright.

example.voku: Ka sela-hima move eno sana-kema.
example.gloss: DECL asteroid move in orbit
example.english: The asteroid moves in orbit.

example.voku: Ka sana-supa tuve meli-ari sana.
example.gloss: DECL galaxy have billion star
example.english: The galaxy has billions of stars.

words.etymology: from hima (sky) + tor (all) — all of sky/space

example.voku: Ka hima-tor ure vasi sino fine.
example.gloss: DECL universe be vast without end
example.english: The universe is vast without end.

example.voku: Ka sana-foma pine fora eno hima.
example.gloss: DECL constellation form image in sky
example.english: The constellation forms a pattern in the sky.

example.voku: Ka furi-hima ure eno tore de-sana.
example.gloss: DECL void be between star
example.english: The void lies between the stars.

example.voku: Ka fale-sana lumi eno hima.
example.gloss: DECL meteor glow in sky
example.english: The meteor glows in the sky.

example.voku: Ka luna-heke heke sola.
example.gloss: DECL eclipse hide sun
example.english: The eclipse hides the sun.

example.voku: Ka pure-tera sake kosa eno hima-kosa.
example.gloss: DECL gravity hold body on planet
example.english: Gravity holds things on the planet.

example.voku: Ka sana-nava move eno hima-loka.
example.gloss: DECL starship move in outer-space
example.english: The starship moves through outer space.

example.voku: Ka pile-kosa pure kosa eko tera.
example.gloss: DECL force pull body toward earth
example.english: The force pulls the body toward earth.

example.voku: Ka ama-foma fore pova ulo furi-hima.
example.gloss: DECL wave carry energy through void
example.english: The wave carries energy through the void.

example.voku: Ka puli-kosa move rapi eno furi-hima.
example.gloss: DECL particle move fast in void
example.english: The particle moves fast through the void.

words.etymology: from puli (small) + pova (energy) — small energy unit

example.voku: Ka tor kosa meke-pu eso puli-pova.
example.gloss: DECL all thing create-PASS from atom
example.english: Everything is made of atoms.

example.voku: Ka sana meke-pu eso hoti-afa.
example.gloss: DECL star create-PASS from plasma
example.english: Stars are made of plasma.

example.voku: Ka pure-pova kore sana-nava eso safi-luma.
example.gloss: DECL magnetic-force guard starship from radiation
example.english: Magnetic force shields the starship from radiation.

example.voku: Ka rapi-move aze pora eko ali-hima.
example.gloss: DECL warp open door toward dimension
example.english: The warp opens a door to another dimension.

example.voku: Ka safi-luma eso sana ure mali.
example.gloss: DECL radiation from star be harmful
example.english: Radiation from the star is harmful.

example.voku: Ka sana-nava move eko sana-supa ali.
example.gloss: DECL starship move toward galaxy other
example.english: The starship travels to another galaxy.

example.voku: Ka move-kila pore pova eko sana-nava.
example.gloss: DECL engine give energy toward starship
example.english: The engine provides power to the starship.

example.voku: Ka kore-mura kore sana-nava eso safi-luma.
example.gloss: DECL shield guard starship from radiation
example.english: The shield protects the starship from radiation.

example.voku: Ka sene-kila tore hima-kosa eno furi-hima.
example.gloss: DECL sensor search planet in void
example.english: The sensor searches for planets in space.

example.voku: Ka eso-fela de-sana-nava ure kumi.
example.gloss: DECL hull of-starship be strong
example.english: The starship's hull is strong.

example.voku: Ka pine-runa ure eno pine-zena.
example.gloss: DECL pilot be in cockpit
example.english: The pilot is in the cockpit.

example.voku: Ka sere-zena sere mani kosa.
example.gloss: DECL cargo-hold store many thing
example.english: The cargo hold stores many things.

example.voku: Ka sana-nava ore eno nava-loka.
example.gloss: DECL starship arrive at dock
example.english: The starship arrives at the dock.

example.voku: Ka luma-zimi kire sela-hima.
example.gloss: DECL laser cut asteroid
example.english: The laser cuts the asteroid.

example.voku: Ka sana-nava ule rapi-move poro ore rapi.
example.gloss: DECL starship use warp for arrive fast
example.english: The starship uses warp to arrive quickly.

example.voku: Ka pile-kila pine sana-nava eno hima-loka.
example.gloss: DECL thruster steer starship in space
example.english: The thruster steers the starship in space.

words.etymology: from sana (star) + tore (search) + kila (tool) — star search tool

example.voku: Ka sol sure sana-tore-kila eko hima-kosa.
example.gloss: DECL 1SG send probe toward planet
example.english: I send a probe to the planet.

words.etymology: from sana (star) + zira (circle) — circling star object

example.voku: Ka sana-zira move aro hima-kosa.
example.gloss: DECL satellite move around planet
example.english: The satellite orbits the planet.

example.voku: Ka sone-kila sure seta eko sana-nava.
example.gloss: DECL beacon send signal toward starship
example.english: The beacon sends a signal to the starship.

example.voku: Ka ali-runa voke voku ali.
example.gloss: DECL alien speak language other
example.english: The alien speaks another language.

example.voku: Ka hima-kosa tuve mani vere-foma.
example.gloss: DECL planet have many species
example.english: The planet has many species.

example.voku: Ka supa-tama tire eno hima-kosa novi.
example.gloss: DECL colony grow on planet new
example.english: The colony grows on the new planet.

example.voku: Ka ali-runa vere eno supa-soma.
example.gloss: DECL alien live in hive
example.english: The aliens live in a hive.

example.voku: Ka mute-runa tuve pova ta mu-nomi ti.
example.gloss: DECL mutant have power REL NEG-normal
example.english: The mutant has unusual powers.

example.voku: Ka simi-runa veke sami eni runa-sena.
example.gloss: DECL clone look same as original
example.english: The clone looks the same as the original.

example.voku: Ka kufa-runa take toka eni runa.
example.gloss: DECL android do task like human
example.english: The android performs tasks like a human.

example.voku: Ka zuke-runa ure pati runa en pati kufa.
example.gloss: DECL cyborg be part human and part machine
example.english: The cyborg is part human and part machine.

example.voku: Ka mina-runa lire mina de-runa ali.
example.gloss: DECL telepath read mind of-person other
example.english: The telepath reads other people's minds.

example.voku: Ka vire-soma mute vire de-soma.
example.gloss: DECL shapeshifter change shape of-body
example.english: The shapeshifter changes its body's form.

example.voku: Ka fari-loka ure eno fini de-sana-supa.
example.gloss: DECL outpost be at edge of-galaxy
example.english: The outpost is at the edge of the galaxy.

example.voku: Ka tor-teru reku mani hima-kosa.
example.gloss: DECL federation govern many planet
example.english: The federation governs many planets.

words.etymology: from mu (neg) + reku (rule) + runa (agent) — rule-rejecting agent

example.voku: Ka mu-reku-runa mu-ule reku de-tor-teru.
example.gloss: DECL rebel NEG-follow rule of-federation
example.english: The rebel does not follow the federation's rules.

example.voku: Ka heke-sele fore kosa heke ulo hima-loka.
example.gloss: DECL smuggler carry thing hidden through space
example.english: The smuggler carries goods secretly through space.

words.etymology: from tina (reward) + tore (search) + runa (agent) — reward-seeking agent

example.voku: Ka tina-tore-runa tore mu-reku-runa.
example.gloss: DECL bounty-hunter search rebel
example.english: The bounty hunter searches for the rebel.

example.voku: Ka sana-nava kele heno sana-tina.
example.gloss: DECL starship cost hundred credit
example.english: The starship costs a hundred credits.

example.voku: Ka luma-fora veke eni runa veri.
example.gloss: DECL hologram look like person real
example.english: The hologram looks like a real person.

example.voku: Ka runa vere eno fasi-loka en mu-sene da-pre.
example.gloss: DECL person live in simulation and NEG-know it
example.english: The person lives in a simulation and doesn't know it.

words.etymology: new root: po- (potential) + -va (vital force) — vital potential

example.voku: Ka sana-nava neke pova poro move.
example.gloss: DECL starship need energy for move
example.english: The starship needs energy to move.
